channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump threatens to sue over article about Epstein. And, what's next for public media

item.title: Trump’s NPR and PBS Funding Cuts Were Decades in the Making
item.description: The cuts speak to President Trump’s grip on his party but also to the sweeping changes in media.

item.title: Alan Bergman, Half of a Prolific Lyric-Writing Team, Dies at 99
item.description: With his wife, Marilyn, he wrote the words to memorable TV theme songs and the Oscar-winning “The Way We Were” and “The Windmills of Your Mind.”

item.title: U.S. politicians want to reshore manufacturing. But what makes it so special?

item.title: Ask your kids' camps these key questions about heat and flood safety, experts say

item.title: The Seeds of Democratic Revival Have Already Been Sown
item.description: The party is getting pummeled. But it can fight back.

item.title: Felix Baumgartner, Skydiver Who Jumped From the Edge of Space, Dies Paragliding at 56
item.description: Nicknamed “Fearless Felix,” Mr. Baumgartner jumped from the edge of space in 2012.

item.title: Floods and Heavy Rain Kill Dozens in Pakistan
item.description: Relentless rain began on Wednesday, causing flooding in several cities and across vast rural stretches in the province of Punjab.
